description: ink line drawing of seven standing men, all wearing robes; three men wear hats; bald man at center has long beard
inscription:
Inscription and Seal

ULC, in black: untranslated inscription
text:
In the third century CE, during a time of social and political upheaval, a group of literati men withdrew into nature, opting for a life of drinking wine and engaging in music, poetry, and scholarly discussions. Known as the “Seven Sages of the Bamboo Grove,” these men represent the desire to pursue individual expression and freedom rather than serve a corrupt government.

Su Renshan’s paintings are known for their sparse calligraphic brushwork and simple compositions that defied academic painting traditions. Here, he interpreted the Seven Sages with nearly cartoonish brevity. He omitted the bamboo grove entirely to focus on the figures themselves.
title: The Seven Sages of the Bamboo Grove
